## Introduction

In this tutorial series, we will migrate Node patterns from Unity to Godot using Godot's basic principles.

Godot is a free and open-source game engine that can be used to make 2D and 3D games. It is a game engine developed by the same people who created Blender and the Python scripting language.

One of the main differences between Unity and Godot is how they handle nodes. In Unity, nodes are used to build up a hierarchy of objects that can be manipulated and interacted with through the Unity editor. In Godot, the equivalent would be to use scenes and scripts.

Open Godot and create a new project.

### 2. Create a New Scene

In Godot, we don't have nodes like in Unity. Instead, we work with scenes and scripts. Create a new scene (right-click in the Project panel and select New > Scene).
